rdf:Description.dc:title: Working in Alberta : a guide for internationally trained and educated immigrants 2004 a guide for internationally trained and educated immigrants.
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Alberta. Alberta Human Resources and Employment.
rdf:Description.dc:publisher: Edmonton, Alta. : Alberta Human Resources and Employment,
rdf:Description.dc:description: "Have you obtained your education and skills training outside of Canada? Working in Alberta can help you research your occupation in Alberta, look at other work alternatives and become familiar with the Alberta workplace. You'll find information on topics including recognition of international qualifications, registration and certification, occupational information, career management, job search skills and the labour market. It also includes information about the agencies, professional organizations, government departments, websites and publications that can help during this period of transition."--Publisher's description.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Immigrants
Immigrants
Skilled labor
Immigrants
